Med prijetimi tihotapci tobaka na Hrvaškem tudi slovenska državljana
01 Nov 2019, 11:04 by STA

Hrvaška policija je v četrtek prijela enajst oseb, osumljenih tihotapljenja tobaka, med njimi dva slovenska državljana. Policisti sumijo, da je skupina oškodovala hrvaški proračun za najmanj 31,6 milijona kun (4,3 milijona evrov).



Foto: Wikipedia

ZAGREB, KOPRIVNICA > Koprivniško-križevška policijska uprava je v četrtek potrdila, da so med kriminalistično preiskavo Nicotiana 3 prijeli osem hrvaških državljanov, dva državljana Slovenije ter državljana Bosne in Hercegovine. Iščejo še enega hrvaškega državljana, ki je del kriminalne združbe.
Osumljeni so več kaznivih dejanj, povezanih z nezakonitim uvozom najmanj 52 ton listov tobaka na Hrvaško. Tobak naj bi pretihotapili na Hrvaško čez več držav članic Evropske unije, so še zapisali na spletni strani policijske uprave s sedežem v Koprivnici. Objavili so tudi več fotografij, na katerih je videti številne lesene palete s škatlami tobaka in orodjem za rezanje tobačnih listov.
Po navedbah policije so osumljeni liste tobaka obdelali in jih prodajali na črnem trgu med marcem in oktobrom letos. Na ta način so na nezakonit način precej zaslužili, z neplačevanjem trošarin pa so oškodovali hrvaški državni proračun za najmanj 31,6 milijona kun. Vseh dvanajst osumljenih so kazensko ovadili, enajst prijetih pa je v priporu.

Among the arrested tobacco smugglers in Croatia is a Slovenian citizen
01 Nov 2019, 11:04 by STA

Croatian police arrested eleven suspected tobacco smugglers on Thursday, including two Slovenian citizens. Police say the group has damaged the Croatian budget by at least 31.6 million kuna (4.3 million euros).



Photo: Wikipedia

ZAGREB, KOPRIVNICA> The Koprivnica-Križevci Police Administration confirmed on Thursday that eight Croat citizens, two Slovenian citizens and a citizen of Bosnia and Herzegovina, were arrested during a criminal investigation into Nicotian 3. They are looking for another Croatian citizen who is part of a criminal organization.
Several offenses related to the illegal import of at least 52 tonnes of tobacco leaves into Croatia are suspected. Tobacco is allegedly smuggled into Croatia across several EU Member States, the police headquarters in Koprivnica wrote on the website. They also posted a number of photos showing many wooden pallets with boxes of tobacco and a tool for cutting tobacco leaves.
According to police, the suspected tobacco leaves were processed and sold on the black market between March and October this year. In this way, they have been making a lot of money illegally, and by not paying excise duties they have damaged the Croatian state budget by at least HRK 31.6 million. All twelve suspects have been criminally charged and eleven arrested are in custody.
